intro: Saba florida, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and the plant is often grown for its ornamental value. Saba florida thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil.
